definitions.definition: To improve, usually applied to technology, generally by complete replacement of one or more components.
examples: When you upgrade your standard of living, you become addicted to that standard of living.
I had to upgrade my anti-virus software to protect my computer from the newer threats.

definitions.definition: To improve the equipment or furnishings of or services rendered to.
examples: They upgraded him to the latest model.
They were upgraded to first class.

definitions.definition: To improve in condition or status.
examples: She upgraded to a more successful husband.

definitions.definition: To replace a program with a later version of itself, a version having a higher version number or marketed under a more recent product name.
examples: She waited a long time to upgrade from Windows 10 to Windows 11, hoping the worst bugs would be worked out before she took the plunge.
She waited a long time to upgrade Windows, hoping the worst bugs would be worked out before she took the plunge.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To improve, usually applied to technology, generally by complete replacement of one or more components.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To replace with something better.
( transitive ) To improve the equipment or furnishings of or services rendered to.
( intransitive ) To improve in condition or status.
( intransitive , transitive , computing ) To replace a program with a later version of itself, a version having a higher version number or marketed under a more recent product name.
